```{python}
#| label: setup

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Set colors for plots
purple = '#8E44AD'
yellow = '#F1C40F'

# Sample data
data = pd.DataFrame({
    'Category': ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D'],
    'Value': [10, 20, 15, 25]
})
```

# Welcome to My Purple and Yellow Website

This is a sample Quarto document that demonstrates how to create a website with a purple and yellow theme.

## Sample Plot

Here's a sample plot using our theme colors:

```{python}
#| label: sample-plot
#| fig-cap: "Sample Bar Plot"

plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
bars = plt.bar(data['Category'], data['Value'], color=purple)
plt.title('Sample Bar Plot', color=purple)
plt.xlabel('Category', color=purple)
plt.ylabel('Value', color=purple)
plt.tick_params(colors=purple)
for bar in bars:
    height = bar.get_height()
    plt.text(bar.get_x() + bar.get_width()/2., height,
             f'{height}',
             ha='center', va='bottom', color=yellow)
plt.show()
```
